definition: lit. to reply "don't know" whatever the question (idiom)/fig. absolutely no idea of what's going on/complete ignorance
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to ask
surname San
three/3
(negative prefix)/not/no
to know/to be aware
(idiom) to sidestep the question/to answer evasively
to speak evasively (idiom); beating about the bush
to be confused/to be baffled
to equivocate/to talk evasively (idiom)
able to reply quickly and fluently (idiom); having a ready answer
puzzled/bewildered
to hem and haw/to stall/to stammer/to mumble/to falter
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
to play deaf-mute
lit. to know one and understand half (idiom); a smattering of knowledge/dilettante/amateur
confused/vague/indistinct/muddle-headed/mixed up/in a daze
variant of 糊裡糊塗|糊里糊涂[hu2 li5 hu2 tu2]
(idiom) reluctant to speak about it/tight-lipped
to refuse to say anything about (idiom)/to remain tight-lipped/to avoid mentioning
to know nothing about the beginning, the middle or the end/to know nothing at all
to keep silent (idiom)
to arbitrarily assert/to allege/to stick to one's statement/to cling to one's view
